personalInfo.name: Patrick Luong
personalInfo.title: Full Stack Developer
personalInfo.bio: I am a self-driven full-stack developer with a strong background in building modern, scalable web applications. I have a passion for learning new technologies and solving complex problems.

keyResponsibilities: Contributed to the design and development of a robust automated test suite (Python, Robot Framework, Selenium), automating over 200 test cases and reducing manual testing efforts by 65% for each release cycle.

Configured test stages of Jenkins CI/CD pipeline for automated execution and integration of test results with Jira and X-ray Test Management. Implemented parallel execution, decreasing pipeline duration from 2hrs to 1hr.
Worked closely with developers to identify, troubleshoot, and thoroughly document software bugs, allowing for swift resolution.
Wrote onboarding documentation for new team members in Confluence wiki detailing the test suite structure and operation, allowing them to contribute sooner.
Designed and built a full-stack web application (Vue.js, Node.js, Express, OracleDB, Cypress) to streamline transaction report processing for FINTRAC analysts, serving a team of 40+ users.
Integrated the application into existing FINTRAC microservices architecture using RESTful APIs, to allow for authentication/authorization (JWT), and database CRUD functionality.
Optimized load times of an essential component containing transaction reports by 10x through the implementation of pagination and database indexing, significantly enhancing user experience.
Developed and maintained microservices (C#, ASP.NET, Azure SQL) that enabled the grain lab to streamline data processing and efficiently manage large volumes of experiment data.

Improved network efficiency by migrating legacy microservices from REST APIs to gRPC and Protobufs, resulting in 8x faster response times, 50% decrease in data payload size, and significant cost savings on Azure.

Designed and implemented a new Quality Control Service and dashboard (Angular) to ensure the accuracy and reliability of grain analysis results. The service included automated quality checks and flagged erroneous results for manual review in the dashboard.
